description: {"blocks":[{"key":"99nbd","text":"Purpose:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frg5t","text":"This protocol details processing fixed paraffin sections from human pancreas for the Nanostring GeoMX digital spatial profiler (DSP) whole transcriptome assay (WTA). This technology is based upon hybridization of samples with RNA reagents composed of \u003e20,000 probes for full coverage of protein covering mRNA. The RNA probes are designed with complimentary RNA sequences and UV cleavable linkers and DSP barcodes. Morphology markers are used to identify cell types of interest with nuclear counterstaining permitting tissue spatial information. Sample regions of interest (ROI) are defined based on the 4 morphology markers and each ROI is illuminated with UV light thereby cleaving hybridized RNA probes. Cleaved probes are aspirated via microcapillary and deposited into a unique well of a 96-well collection plate. The collection plate is used for next generation sequencing (NGS). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8elnt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6jv07","text":"Scope:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2p06","text":"This document was written following GeoMX- NGS guidelines (university.nanostring.com) with minor modifications for the University of Florida Molecular Pathology Core. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"8q769","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gm3t","text":"The entire workflow is described for manual slide staining and GeoMX DSP instrument use. Steps for library construction, sequencing, bioinformatics, and data analysis are in outline form only. Library preparation and sequencing are outsourced to the University of Florida ICBR facility.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t6mc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rhe1","text":"Expected outcome:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p6et","text":"RNA suitable for bulk RNA-sequencing will be obtained from fixed human pancreas sections within regions of interest and subareas defined by cell morphology markers.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1492B931EDA511EC91E20A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://university.nanostring.com"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cths5","text":"Make RNA probe hybridization solution as per Table 1. Before use, briefly vortex and quick spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u4mb","text":"Carefully wash all containers coming into contact with the hybridization solution (Proteinase K, formamide mixture 2XSSC) with RNAse AWAY to prevent probe contamination.
